captions.text:
>> Jon: WELCOME TO "THE DAILY
SHOW"!

MY NAME IS JON STEWART! GOOD
SHOW!

MY GUEST TONIGHT, AUTHOR JENNY
NORDBERG, SHE IS THE AUTHOR OF A

BOOK CALLED "THE UNDERGROUND
GIRLS OF KABUL."

SHE WILL BE JOINING US A LITTLE
BIT LATER.

BUT FIRST, NEW YORK CITY HOSTED
THE BIGGEST CLIMATE CHANGE MARCH

IN HISTORY YESTERDAY
FEATURING THE BIGGEST HAT

AND THE BIGGEST SIGN AND
THE BIGGEST KINDEST

PUPPET LIBRARIAN AND THE
BIGGEST PAIN IN THE ASS

TO GET ACROSS THE STREET
JUST TO GET TO CHIPOTLE.
>> THERE WERE BOLD FACED NAMES.

FORMER VICE PRESIDENT AL GORE,
MAYOR BILL DeBLASIO, AND U.N.
SECRETARY GENERAL BAN KI-MOON.
>> Jon: WHOA! WHOA!
STOP THE PARADE!
BAN KI-MOON?

THE BIGGEST CLIMATE CHANGE IN
HISTORY.

WHAT DID YOU COME STRAIGHT FROM
YOUR AUDITION FROM

"YOU'RE A GOOD MAN,
CHARLIE BROWN"?

LOOK AT YOU! YOU'RE WEARING YOUR
CAMP CLOTHES?

YOU'RE BAN KI-MOON! YOU'RE THE
HEAD OF THE U.N.
BY THE WAY, WHAT A GET FOR
U.N. RADIO.
U.N. RADIO GETTING BAN KI-MOON.
NO, NO, I CAN'T TALK TO YOU.
OH! HELLO.

(LAUGHTER)
OF COURSE, POLITICIAN WEREN'T

THE ONLY BIG SHOTS ON HAND.
THERE WERE A-LIST MOVIE

STARS LIKE MARK
RUFFALO AND EDWARD NORTON, BOTH

HAVE BECOME ACUTELY AWARE OF
ENVIRONMENTAL DANGERS SINCE

THEIR ENCOUNTERS WITH GAMMA
RADIATION. THEY REALLY HAD...

(LAUGHTER)
(APPLAUSE)

>> Jon: WITH THAT SIZE IN STAR
POWER, YOU KNOW CABLE NEWS GAVE
IT EVERYTHING THEY HAVE.

>> ALISON KOSIK IS IN NEW
YORK. DESCRIBE THE SCENE FOR US

EARLIER.
>> EARLIER?

IT'S ACTUALLY HAPPENING AS WE
SPEAK.

(LAUGHTER)
>> Jon: PERHAPS IT'S HAPPENING
RIGHT NOW.

PERHAPS YOU CAN TELL BY THE FACT
THAT NOBODY CAN SEE ME IN MY OWN
NEWS REPORT.
COME ON, CNN!
THIS IS CROWD FOOTAGE 101!

YOU PUT THE REPORTER IN FRONT OF
THE CROWD!
MSNBC, SHOW THEM HOW IT'S DONE.

>> LET'S HEAD THERE NOW. WE HAVE
NED RESNIKOFF WHO'S STAND BY --
>> Jon: [BLEEP]! OH, JESUS!
NOT THAT FAR!
COME ON!

(LAUGHTER)
KILL THE FEED!

GOT A GIANT METEOR APPROACHING
THE PARADE!

AHHH!
(LAUGHTER)

WITH YESTERDAY'S SOUP IN HIS
STASH!
(LAUGHTER)

ALL RIGHT, NOW YOU MAY BE
THINKING, DO WE REALLY NEED A

MARCH TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT
GLOBAL CLIMATE CHANGE?

I MEAN, IT'S AN ACCEPTED
SCIENTIFIC PHENOMENON PRETTY
MUCH EVERYWHERE.
HERE'S WHY YOU NEED THE MARCH.

IT'S ACCEPTED PRETTY MUCH
EVERYWHERE BUT THIS ONE PLACE

CALLED THE UNITED STATES HOUSE
OF REPRESENTATIVES COMMITTEE ON
SCIENCE, SPACE AND TECHNOLOGY.
THIS IS TRUE.

LAST WEEK THEY HELD A HEARING
THAT THEY APPARENTLY RECORDED IN

1971 --
(LAUGHTER)

I GUESS THAT'S THE TECHNOLOGY
PART OF THE COMMITTEE NAME -- ON

PRESIDENT OBAMA'S PLAN TO SHRINK
CARBON EMISSIONS 30% BY 2030.

THE HEARINGS' SISYPHUS,
PRESIDENTIAL SCIENCE ADVISOR

JOHN HOLDREN, CHARGED
WITH THE IMPOSSIBLE TASK OF

PUSHING 1 MILLION POUNDS
OF IDIOT UP A MOUNTAIN.

OF COURSE, LIKE ANY AVALANCHE,
IT DID BEGAN RATHER INNOCUOUSLY.
TEXAS REPUBLICAN STEVE STOCKMAN.

>> THE LEAD SCIENTIST AT NASA
SAID THIS, HE SAID WHAT ENDED
THE ICE AGE WAS GLOBAL WOBBLING.

IS THE WOBBLING OF THE EARTH
INCLUDED IN ANY OF YOUR
MODELINGS?
AND THE ANSWER WAS NO.

WHEN YOU HAVE A MODEL AND YOU
SAY WE'LL LEAVE OUT THE MOST

IMPORTANT IMPACT OF THAT MODEL
OUT OF OUR THEORY AND NOT TALK

ABOUT GLOBAL WOBBLING, HOW CAN
YOU MAKE PROJECTIONS?

(LAUGHTER)
>> Jon: WHAT'S UP, SCIENTISTS?
GLOBAL WOBBLING, BITCHES!

(LAUGHTER)
HE SEES YOUR SO-CALLED GLOBAL

WARMING AND RAISES YOU A
GLOBAL WOBBLING.
EXPLAIN THAT DR. WHITE HOUSE.

>> GLOBAL WOBBLING WHICH REFERS
TO CHANGES IN THE EARTH'S

TILT AND ORBIT TAKES PLACE ON
CHARACTERISTIC TIME SCALES OF

22,000 YEARS, 44,000 YEARS AND
100,000 YEARS. IT IS VERY SLOW.

GLOBAL WOBBLES IS A TINY EFFECT
OF THE TIME SCALE OF 100 YEARS

IN WHICH WE TRY TO RUN THESE
MODELS.

>> Jon: I DIDN'T KNOW WE WOULD
BE TALKING TO AN ACTUAL
SCIENTIST...

(WHISPERING)
ALL RIGHT, HOLDREN, YOU ACED
THE WOBBLE WARMING.
RIDDLE ME THIS:

>> AT WHAT POINT A LEVEL OF CO2
DOES CO2 BECOME DAMAGING?

AT WHAT LEVEL DOES IT BECOME
HARMFUL TO HUMAN BEINGS?

>> Jon: BOOM! HOW CAN CO2 BE
DANGEROUS WHEN I CAN STILL
BREATHE?

>> VICE CHAIRMAN ROHRABACHER, I
ALWAYS ENJOY MY INTERACTIONS
WITH YOU.

>> Jon: MUCH THE WAY ONE
ENJOYS PLAYING PEEK A BOO WITH A

BABY.
(LAUGHTER)

>> Jon: OR PERHAPS TEASING A
CAT WITH A LASER POINTER!

(LAUGHTER)
>> I HAVE TO SAY WITH RESPECT
THAT'S A RED HERRING.

WE ARE NOT INTERESTED IN CARBON
DIOXIDE CONCENTRATIONS BECAUSE

OF THEIR DIRECT EFFECT ON HUMAN
HEALTH, WE'RE INTERESTED IN THEM

BECAUSE OF THEIR EFFECT ON THE
WORLD'S CLIMATE AND CLIMATE

CHANGE HAS DISASTEROUS EFFECTS
ON HEALTH.

>> Jon: WHY CAN WE STILL
BREATHE?

THAT'S WHAT I'M ASKING! I MEAN,
YOU CAN HEAR ME RIGHT?
I'M BREATHING!

AND IT GOT MORE AMAZING AS IT
WENT.
INDIANA'S LARRY BUSCHON.

>> IT'S NOT ABOUT AFFECTING THE
GLOBAL TEMPERATURE AND CLIMATE
CHANGE.

>> THERE IS PUBLIC COMMENTS OUT
THERE THAT QUESTION HAS BEEN
ASKED AND ANSWERED SAYING NO.

>> YOU SHOULD LOOK AT THE
SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE RATHER
THAN THE PUBLIC COMMENTS.

(LAUGHTER)
(APPLAUSE)

>> Jon: WITH ALL DUE
RESPECT, REPRESENTATIVE

BUSCHON, I SUGGEST YOU GET THE
JOURNAL OF APPLIED
METEOROLOGY AND CLIMATOLOGY AS

OPPOSED TO THE YOU TUBE
COMMENT FEED OF OBUMMERLIES1776.

BUT HERE'S WHERE BUSCHON FINALLY
GIVES AWAY THE GAME.

>> OF ALL THE CLIMATOLOGISTS
WHOSE CAREER DEPENDS ON THE

CLIMATE CHANGING TO KEEP
THEMSELVES PUBLISHING ARTICLES,

YES, I COULD READ THAT BUT I
DO NOT BELIEVE IT.

>> Jon: I DO NOT BELIEVE THE
SCIENTISTS BECAUSE IT IS THEIR

PROFESSION NOT THEIR HOBBY.
(LAUGHTER)

WELL SINCE WE'RE TALKING ABOUT
THE INFLUENCE MONEY MIGHT HAVE

ON CLIMATE CHANGE OPINION,
IT TURNS OUT REPRESENTATIVE

BUSCHON'S THREE BIGGEST CAMPAIGN
DONORS ARE MURRAY ENERGY,

KOCH ENTERPRISES, AND PEABODY
ENERGY. AND TRUST ME.

(AUDIENCE REACTS)
TRUST ME, THOSE THREE WELL

FUNDED COMPANIES WOULD
LOVE TO DISPROVE CLIMATE CHANGE.

TO THE SATISFACTION OF
THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY AT

LARGE. SO IF SCIENTISTS COULD BE
BOUGHT THESE MOTHER [BLEEP]

WOULD HAVE ALREADY MADE IT RAIN
IN NERD TOWN. TRUST ME.

AND AGAIN, I CAN'T STRESS THIS
ENOUGH.

THIS IS THE HOUSE OF
REPRESENTATIVES COMMITTEE ON
SCIENCE, SPACE AND TECHNOLOGY.

>> HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE FOR THE
SEA LEVEL TO RISE TWO FEET?

I MEAN, THINK ABOUT IT, IF YOUR
ICE CUBE MELTS IN YOUR GLASS, IT

DOESN'T OVERFLOW,
IT'S DISPLACEMENT. I MEAN,

THESE ARE SOME OF THE THINGS
THEY'RE TALKING ABOUT THAT

MATHEMATICALLY AND
SCIENTIFICALLY DON'T MAKE SENSE.

>> Jon: ARE YOU [BLEEP] KIDDING
ME?
ARE YOU [BLEEP] KIDDING ME?

I DON'T EVEN KNOW --
(CHEERS AND APPLAUSE)

I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHAT TO DO
WITH THAT!

HOW FAR BACK TO THE ELEMENTARY
SCHOOL CORE CURRICULUM DO WE

HAVE TO GO TO GET SOMEONE ON THE
HOUSE COMMITTEE ON SCIENCE,
SPACE AND TECHNOLOGY CAUGHT UP?

DO WE HAVE TO BRING OUT THE
PAPIER MACHE AND BAKING SODA SO

YOU CAN MAKE A (BLEEP) VOLCANO?
IS THAT WHAT WE HAVE TO DO?

IS THAT HOW BASIC THE SCIENCE
CLASS WAS WHEN YOU WENT?

NAH, I DON'T NEED TO KNOW
THIS ANYMORE. FOR GOD'S SAKES!
LOOK, HERE -- HERE, LOOK.
HERE'S A GLASS OF ICE WATER.

HEY, THAT ICE ISN'T MAKING THE
WATER OVERFLOW BECAUSE IT'S
ALREADY IN THE WATER!

BUT IMAGINE THERE'S A WHOLE
BUNCH OF OTHER ICE THAT'S NOT IN

THE WATER, IT'S ON THE LAND --
YOU KNOW, THE PART WHERE THE
WATER ISN'T!

AND THEN WHEN TEMPERATURES RISE
AND THE LAND ICE MELTS ENOUGH,
TO FALL IN, OH, (BLEEP)!
IT'S EVERYWHERE!
IT'S EVERYWHERE!
DO YOU UNDERSTAND?

(CHEERS AND APPLAUSE)
WAIT A MINUTE.
GLOBAL WARMING, GIANT TOWELS.

(LAUGHTER)
ULTIMATELY, THE WHOLE INCREDIBLE

AND BY ALL AAPPEARANCES WILLFUL
MISUNDERSTANDING OF HOW

THE SCIENTIFIC METHOD HAS BEEN
APPLIED TO CLIMATE CHANGE MODELS

AND WHAT THE EFFECTS OF
WARMING CAN BE, PARDON THE

PUN, BOILED DOWN
TO THIS EXCHANGE.

>> THAT SCARE TACTICS LIKE THAT,
YOU KNOW, IS REALLY APPALLING TO

ME TO USE MEDICAL INFORMATION TO
SCARE PARENTS THAT THEIR

CHILDREN ABOUT ASTHMA ATTACKS
AND SCARE PEOPLE SAYING THAT

THEY WERE GOING TO HAVE
HEART ATTACKS.

I ARGUE THAT WE SHOULD ALL ON
BOTH SIDES OF THIS DISCUSSION
AVOID SCARE TACTICS.

>> Jon: FIRST OF ALL, THERE
AREN'T BOTH SIDES TO THE

DISCUSSION. WHAT HE'S
BASICALLY SAYING IS

IT'S UNFAIR TO TALK TO US
ABOUT THE SCIENTIFIC

AND MEDICAL CONSEQUENCES OF OUR
ACTIONS BECAUSE THEY'RE SCARY

AND WE REALLY DON'T FEEL LIKE
DOING ANYTHING ABOUT IT ANYWAY

SO FROM NOW ON WHY NOT AGREE
THAT SCIENCE AND THE OIL
INDUSTRY BOTH HAVE OPINIONS.

OH, AND BEFORE YOU TELL YOUR
KIDS TO WASH THEIR HANDS AFTER

THEY TAKE A (BLEEP) SO THEY
DON'T SPREAD DISEASE, MAYBE WE

SHOULD SPEND AN EQUAL AMOUNT OF
TIME HEARING FROM BIG FECAL.
WE'LL BE RIGHT BACK.

comments.author: 54t4n5w0r5tn1ghtm4r3

comments.text:
It amazes me how the crowd of the Daily Show is laughing when one of their 
Representatives of the people makes these just blatant ignorant comments. 
If these people had no occupation of power, I would laugh it off too, 
especially with Stewart's delivery, but they are not. You might not have 
voted for them or live in their district, but they do make choices for you.
I cannot believe what these people are saying. It makes me want to tear my 
ears of.

Coming from the Netherlands, we're not doing to great on the path to 
sustainability too. But at least here the discussion is not: is global 
climate change real?, that is a generally accepted fact. Here the political 
discussion is about whether we should spend money on the recovering economy 
or on sustainable energy sources. 

I cannot believe that in the educated world, people of office, people of 
influence can make these claims and get away with it. If you would make 
these claims in our House of Representatives, you would be ridiculed by the 
media, the people and your colleagues from all parties.﻿

comments.text:
Jon Stewart disappoints me.  Dr. Bucshon has received campaign 
contributions from a locally owned business called Koch Enterprises of 
Evansville, Indiana, located on 11th Ave, right off the Lloyd Expressway. 
 They are George Koch & Sons, and are not connected to the Koch brothers in 
any way.  He's taken a convenient name and used it to fit an agenda that 
all Republicans are bought and sold by large corporations, when Koch 
Enterprises is a very successful business that has been hugely beneficial 
to Evansville.  Here locally, Dr. Bucshon is a leading cardiologist and is 
well-respected both professionally and in the community.﻿
comments.author: The Man With no Name

comments.text:
Ok, for all of you brainiacs out there: even if there was "global 
warming/climate change going on, the fact that CO2 levels rising would 
somehow damage the planet is ludicrous. You see sheeple, every living thing 
on earth needs carbon dioxide to survive and so if these levels increase it 
will benefit all life forms. In other words there would be more plants, 
thus more food and therefore the oxygen levels would increase. Your 
welcome. However, there is no global warming/climate change happening. I'd 
love to ask old AL GORE how that Arctic Circle melting is going? Or why is 
it that the Antarctic is colder (average mean temperature and the ice layer 
deeper and wider then ever)? And I'd like to tell him that those gigantic 
ice breaks is a normal "calving" of the perimeter because as the ice grows 
outwardly it becomes heavy and cannot hold itself together and so 
breaking apart [ IS A NATURAL CONSEQUENCE ]!! Or what happened to all of 
those glaciers melting into nothingness (glaciers have grown and shrunk 
forever)? Then I'd like to ask him how all of his homes are doing? Are they 
staying warm in the brutal winters? How about your jet Al baby? Are you 
able to keep it fueled with that evil stuff so you can fly around the 
planet stealing money? I would then tell him he needs to study the "Pacific 
Decadel Oscillation" for a while and learn about the effect on climate it 
has on the Northern Hemisphere   ;)   Then I would introduce him to Mr. 
John Coleman as a rebuttal to all of those "scientist's" who claim the 
world is ending thanks to mankind. Then Mr. Coleman would introduce him to 
many thousands of Meteorological Scientist's who disagree with NASA 
(government funded) and all of those other idiots who want tax payer monies 
around the globe. Ok then, this felt good, while I wrote I listened to 
'Money" by Pink Floyd....very fitting indeed. ﻿

comments.text:
stockman kind of has a point.... the scientific method is there for people 
to prove or disprove theories.... Global warming is a theory... he is 
simply saying that if one of the key factors is absent maybe they should 
retool it with it in mind.. and btw for those of you who dont know its 
actually called Climate change.. and is a cycle that happens, will happen, 
and HAS BEEN HAPPENING since the inception of Time itself... is Stockman 
correct in assuming that he has disproved the theory of global warming? 
no... are you serious?... there was plenty of evidence to suggest that 
CLIMATE CHANGE had been occurring well before Al Gore told us his 
Inconvenient Truth. I live in Canada.. most people who havent been here 
know us for our hockey players being better than yours... our beer being 
better than yours.. and lastly our Polar bears walk us to school.. it is 
reasonably chilly most of the year. summer it does get warm not like hot 
but warm around 35C is usually the average after June (figure that out non 
metric users hahaha) and i actually feel we are getting colder.. we had a 
relatively warm period a couple years back but for most of the time i feel 
quite chilly. this is of course M.O.O (My Opinion Only) and since i was a 
little feller i liked to argue.. Still do cept' most times i like a solid 
intellectual debate over who's fart was the loudest. tell me your opinions 
and try and add facts (and a hearty Eh to all fellow Canucks wherever ye 
may be)﻿

comments.author: kpetters

comments.text:
+kpetters wo points:
1. There are many who are aware that water does not rise when ice melts. 
Unfortunately, the anti-global-warming side use this fact by twisting it in 
their campaign of dis-information. They are counting on most people knowing 
only a “little” bit of science. Yes, it's true, that the ocean would not 
rise if the ice burgs in it were to melt. But here comes the point that 
John Stewart could only crudely allude to. Which is that this only applies 
to the north pole where the ice is already in the ocean. Were he in a 
position to elaborate, he'd say that the danger lies in what exists at the 
south pole. There you have a continent about the size of Australia. That 
continent is completely covered in ice that has the average thickness 
between two and a half to three miles. Now if that ice melts, it then 
leaves the land its sitting on and ends up in the ocean, thereby rising the 
sea levels.
 Now as to how high the sea rises? I've heard reports that range anywhere 
from 3 to 300 feet. I honestly don't know which is accurate but suffice it 
to say, that it really does not matter. Even the best case scenario of 3 
feet would still be considered catastrophic. Think about it, there are 
cities around the globe that are highly prone to flooding when hurricanes 
happen. IE: New Orleans. Other places like Holland, have huge dams to keep 
the ocean back. Now New Orleans has devices to measure the oceans rise and 
fall to within a quarter of an inch. If they feel that such a small amount 
of change is worthy of measuring, imagine what 3 feet would mean to them.
 Approximately eighty to ninety percent of the worlds population live by 
the worlds oceans I believe. Were the ocean to rise to catastrophic levels, 
it would not happen in a heart beat but very quickly all the same. As a 
result, there would be over an extremely short time frame, a mass exodus 
inland into other cities ill equipped to handle the sudden influx. Mass 
economic turmoil, food, medical, and housing crises would be the immediate 
result. With more pain to follow.

comments.author: Get a fucking life, will you?!!!

comments.text:
"And Ice Ages last more that 80% of the time". What time? Solar time? UTC? 
Unix time? GMT? Daylight savings time? What time?

Sure, ignore the research. Who cares? The time for action is behind us. 
There's no point arguing about who's right and who isn't. We had a window 
of opportunity and we lost it.

Out of curiosity, what makes you so sure that you're right and the 
overwhelming majority of the scientific are completely wrong about this? I 
mean if it were even 60% for and 40% against, I'd've understood your 
skepticism, but that's hardly the case. So.... Just curious, what research 
have you come across that proves such a vast majority wrong?

And I know I'm beating my head against a giant wall of dipshit here, but 
those time-scales you're talking about and the time-scales we have proof of 
are orders of magnitude apart. So... Yeah, that's me.
comments.author: Get a fucking life, will you?!!!

comments.text:
+Get a fucking life, will you?!!!  There are no climate change deniers 
anywhere. Climate is changing for millions of years and everyone knows. And 
(almost) everyone knows ocean level fluctuates some  400 feet, possibly 
slightly more as some ancient corals on dry land indicates. Right now it's 
pretty much stand still. It may still go little higher IF the temperatures 
reach the same levels as in Holocene Maximum 5000 years ago (I wish). 
But eventually whole Caribbean will be solid land once again with next Ice 
Age. And Ice Ages last more that 80% of the time, we are just lucky to live 
in the Interglacial period. That's the nature of things. And no any Kyoto 
Rain Dance will change that.

comments.author: Rob England

comments.text:
Don't worry too much about America being doomed.  Many of us know the 
difference between a comedian and an actual reporter, though I understand 
that it may be confusing for non US citizens.  These congressmen's primary 
job is to represent their district, not be experts in science - even though 
they sit on an inconsequential committee with "science" in the title.  Just 
remember that it was the US representatives that started NASA and funded it 
over the years, as well as most of the projects that led to knowing about 
climate change in the first place.  

Again - this is a comedian taking things out of context for a laugh.  It's 
not "anti-science nutcases" nor is it doom to the planet.  It's just a dang 
joke.

comments.author: Truth can't be silenced

comments.text:
Two points:
1. There are many who are aware that water does not rise when ice melts. 
Unfortunately, the anti-global-warming side use this fact by twisting it in 
their campaign of dis-information. They are counting on most people knowing 
only a “little” bit of science. Yes, it's true, that the ocean would not 
rise if the ice burgs in it were to melt. But here comes the point that 
John Stewart could only crudely allude to. Which is that this only applies 
to the north pole where the ice is already in the ocean. Were he in a 
position to elaborate, he'd say that the danger lies in what exists at the 
south pole. There you have a continent about the size of Australia. That 
continent is completely covered in ice that has the average thickness 
between two and a half to three miles. Now if that ice melts, it then 
leaves the land its sitting on and ends up in the ocean, thereby rising the 
sea levels.
Now as to how high the sea rises? I've heard reports that range anywhere 
from 3 to 300 feet. I honestly don't know which is accurate but suffice it 
to say, that it really does not matter. Even the best case scenario of 3 
feet would still be considered catastrophic. Think about it, there are 
cities around the globe that are highly prone to flooding when hurricanes 
happen. IE: New Orleans. Other places like Holland, have huge dams to keep 
the ocean back. Now New Orleans has devices to measure the oceans rise and 
fall to within a quarter of an inch. If they feel that such a small amount 
of change is worthy of measuring, imagine what 3 feet would mean to them.
Approximately eighty to ninety percent of the worlds population live by the 
worlds oceans I believe. Were the ocean to rise to catastrophic levels, it 
would not happen in a heart beat but very quickly all the same. As a 
result, there would be over an extremely short time frame, a mass exodus 
inland into other cities ill equipped to handle the sudden influx. Mass 
economic turmoil, food, medical, and housing crises would be the immediate 
result. With more pain to follow.


2. Even if the south pole did not exist and we only had to concern 
ourselves with the melting of the north pole there would still be world 
wide climatic consequences. How? Were that ice to melt it would affect the 
path of the worlds ocean conveyor. “What's that?” you might be asking. Well 
you've no doubt heard of the jet stream. The ocean conveyor is the oceans 
version of the jet stream. And it is this conveyor that actually determines 
how the jet stream behaves. The effects of the ice melting are already 
being felt. As one example, look at tornado alley in the United States. 
With each passing year the size of it is increasing. It's beginning further 
south and stretching further north. Wider to the east and west too. Not 
only that but it's starting earlier in the season and running later too. 
The number of tornadoes reported has increased as well as there sizes and 
wind speeds and even how many are touching down at the same time.﻿

comments.text:
+sheelaflower,  1) Speaking of stupidity. Did anyone say most seals are

comments.author: Edward Dongres

comments.text:
+Edward Dongres I can't believe the stupidity of this comment. Most seals 
are not eaten by polar bears, but by bigger aquatic and semi-aquatic 
mammals, such as killer whales and bigger types of seals. A lot of types of 
seals are fitted to cold water temperatures and live close to the northern 
or southern poles. They of them would die of heat strokes as well as loss 
of habitat if the poles should melt, even IF the polar bears would go 
extinct. Same goes for the fish that the smallest sal kinds are hunting. 
The fish living in the cold waters would radically go extinct for the same 
reasons. Next to that, only the smallest seals eat only fish. The other 
seals eat penguins, other seals, polar foxes, etc. They eat meat, not fish. 
Oh, and I forgot to tell you that penguins live on the southern poles, 
which are also melting, resulting in the loss of habitat and prey.
comments.author: sheelaflower

comments.text:

comments.text:
My biggest problem is people are debating the science of this still and 
NEVER the politics and domestic results. I don't give a crap about whether 
or not the science works honestly. I have my own reservations about whether 
or not the globe is actually warming, but at the same time I don't think it 
matters a lot. Smog, air pollutants, and potential greenhouse gases  in 
general are things we really don't want in our atmosphere, and more 
importantly are often signals of inefficiency.

Yeah, that last bit is leading into the POLITICS, that really matter 
here. How do you get these regulations passed, and yet also allow them to 
benefit society as a whole rather than be a detriment? If they must be a 
detriment to industry, how can you get someone like say, China, to also 
follow these regulations if you do. If you pass them and intentionally 
handicap yourself, industry won't even bother with you and while you rot 
away someone else benefits while making all the pollutants they want (right
